This new activity aims to strengthen local civil society to improve organizational capacity and sustainability. It contributes to the GHI goal of improved governance of the health sector by strengthening civil society capacity, as well as the PEPFAR Blueprint guidance to support and involve local civil society organizations as partners. This mechanism will develop the organizational capacity of local CSO partners that have recently begun receiving direct funds from the USG. These organizations work in the provinces of Maputo City, Maputo, Gaza, Nampula, as well as some national activities.
Organizational priorities will be decided following a participatory capacity assessment, but will likely include the areas of governance, human resources, financial and administrative management, and program management. This award is currently in negotiation phase with a consortium of local capacity-building providers. For each task order issued under this award, and M&E plan will be developed that includes PEPFAR and project specific capacity-building indicators. No funding is requested in COP14.
